alert.note: Alert for Gibson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 9:04PM EDT until June 29 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WARRICK...VANDERBURGH...WEST CENTRAL SPENCER...SOUTH CENTRAL GIBSON...NORTHWESTERN DAVIESS AND NORTHEASTERN HENDERSON COUNTIES... At 803 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Darmstadt, or near Melody Hill, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Evansville, Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Melody Hill, Darmstadt, Stanley, Eureka, Kasson, Elberfeld and Hebbardsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 23. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 25 and 31. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 12 and 16. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
